cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles ESE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas, then curving northwest toward the Florida Peninsula with the center projected to near the southwest Florida coast late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South-west Florida coast (near Naples/Fort Myers area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, especially southwest and west-central coasts from the Keys through Tampa Bay and northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) increasingly likely; 8–13% chance of hurricane-force winds according to the 64-kt table values
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft surge in and around Tampa Bay if Irma tracks up the Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous marine conditions (heavy surf, rip currents) expected ahead of Irma’s approach
